title.narrative: PSE OP 2 - PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Policy dialogue and partnerships with national partners (Government and civil society) are established to contribute to greater national commitment, accountability and capacity to legislate, plan and budget for inclusive social policies and social protection measures., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Economic And Social Policy General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Greater national commitment, accountability and capacity to legislate, plan and budget for inclusive social policies, and progressively integrate social protection measures into relevant programme areas.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Policy dialogue and partnerships with national partners (Government and civil society) are established to contribute to greater national commitment, accountability and capacity to legislate, plan and budget for inclusive social policies and social protection measures.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF continued to encourage more investment in the social sectors in Madagascar through policy dialogue with the newly formed MEF, ministries of social sectors, civil society organisations, members of the National Assembly and Senate, and the Economists of Madagascar thinktank (CREM). Despite significant progress in the course of the 2015-2019 country programme, a number of inter-related challenges have constrained the Public Finance for Children (PF4C) programme. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of capacity building sessions held on social sector budget analysis

actual.value: 2019:7: analysis of budget briefs in social sectors for 5 sectors, reading of the regulatiry law, disaggregation of social policies into regional budgets
